Audit Report.Bug ID: V-BIGINT-COD-001: Missing range checks in BigMod

Missing range checks in BigMod.Short Description of the Vulnerability: The bug in the BigMod template arises from missing range checks on the remainder `mod[i]`, allowing it to exceed the expected range of `2**n`. This underconstrained error can be exploited by providing inputs that result in a remainder larger than `2^n`, potentially compromising the integrity of the circuit. Proper range checks are applied to the quotient `div[i]`, but not to `mod[i]`, leaving the system vulnerable to malicious inputs that break the invariant of the modulus operation.
Missing range checks in BigMod.Short Description of the Exploit: We design a pair of `a` and `b` such that the remainder after `divmod` overflows `2**126`.
Missing range checks in BigMod.Proposed Mitigation: Add additional range checking constraints for `mod[i]`. This can be done using the Num2Bits template.
